message.content:
We must “build” the income‐statement expense total by summing the amounts for all records whose type indicates an expense. In our case this means the records with types such as “Expense…” (whether they are Administrative, Sales, or Financial) plus the Depreciation lines (which are “Depreciation…”). (Items such as “Purchase”, “Initial”, “Fixed Assets …”, “Sale”, “Interest Receivables” and transfers are not expenses.)

Below is a step‐by‐step sketch of the calculation (all amounts are taken from the “amount” field):

1. Expense20240101001 (Administrative Expenses): 31,077.04  
2. Depreciation20240101001 (Depreciation): 45,751.31

Adding these step‐by‐step yields a grand total of approximately 2,830,959.47.

Thus the final total expenses item on the income statement is 2,830,959.47.

We now present the answer in the required JSON format:
